chargeHist.descr: 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide use of dangerous weapon as repeater

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse A. MORENO Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide with use of dangerous weapon as repeater [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Repeater], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay restitution to George Perry for funeral expenses.  Court orders financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  The balance remaining at release from prison to be paid as a condition of extended supervision at a rate determined by the supervising agent.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Have no contact with Kokoya Perry's family without agent's approval.

Write a letter of apology to Kokoyo Perry's family and specifically to his mother, George.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse A. MORENO Jr.

Transcript of sentencing hearing held on 06-12-15.
Associated with Charge #1
Copy of Complaint, Information, Amended Information and minutes to DOC.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights.
Settlement conference Summary.

Defendant in custody.
The State files an Amended Information which amends the charge to 2nd degree reckless homicide with use of dangerous weapon as repeater, contrary to Sections 940.06(1), 939.62(1)(c) and 939.63(1)(b) of the Wisconsin Statutes.
GUILTY plea entered to the amended charge. Convicted.
The Court orders a Presentence Investigation Report be completed by DOC.
PSI is due to the court by 06-01-15.
Sentencing is set for 06-12-15 at 1:30 p.m.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.   
Neither side has any objections to the motions in limine other than the State wishing to address the issue of having Detective McGinty assist as court officer.  Defense counsel has no objection.  
Pretrial conference set for 04-06-15 at 1:30 p.m. to resolve any outstanding issues before trial.

Motion hearing held.   Testimony presented.   Court denies the motion to suppress statements.

Defendant in custody.  
The parties stipulate that the Court can view the video of defendant's interrogation prior to addressing the Miranda motion.  Defense counsel wishes to supplement its current motion regarding the violent acts of the victim which is to be filed by 02-02-15.  
Motion hearing set for 02-13-15 at 1:30 p.m.  
Court gives counsel until 03-02-15 at file any jury instructions and proposed verdicts.

ARRAIGNMENT-
Information filed. Defendant waives the reading of the Information.
Not guilty plea entered to the charge contained in the Information.  Jury Calendar.
Settlement conference with the District Attorney set for 06-18-14 at 1:15 p.m.
MOTION -
The State advises the Court that the victim's body is still being held by the coronor.  The family would like the body released.  Defense has no objections to the body of Koyoko Perry being released to his family.
The Court so orders.

RE:  Kokoya Perry, on 04-27-14.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of 1st degree intentional homicide.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 05-05-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $250,000.00 cash with the  conditions that he have no contat with the victim's mother, George Perry and with M.G. and J.H.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
